alert.note: Alert for Amite; Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall; Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 30 at 2:15PM CDT until August 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS IN SOUTH LOUISIANA AND PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA... .In coordination with state and federal fire weather officials, a red flag warning has been issued for today due to a combination of the severe to extreme drought across the area, low relative humidity, wind gusts of 20 mph and area-wide burn bans. Conditions will improve slightly on Thursday, but fuels will continue to be primed for ignition due to the drought. A fire danger statement will replace the fire weather watch. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE CONDITIONS ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST LOUISIANA AND ALL OF SOUTHWEST AND COASTAL MISSISSIPPI.. ...THE FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR THURSDAY WILL BE REPLACED BY A FIRE DANGER STATEMENT... The National Weather Service in New Orleans has cancelled the Fire Weather Watch. * AFFECTED AREA...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi that are generally along and north of a line from Morgan City to Slidell to Pascagoula. * WINDS...North 10 to 15 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 29 percent. * IMPACTS...Any ongoing or new fires will likely spread rapidly
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Burn bans remain in effect for all of southeastern Louisiana and southwestern and coastal Mississippi with no exemptions. Any burning is strictly prohibited. To help prevent ignition or spread of fire, do not park vehicles on dry grass. Ensure any trailer chains do not drag on pavement creating sparks. Fully extinguish all cigarettes before disposing in a proper container. And report any observed fires to 911 immediately.
